bioprojects.title: Corvus moneduloides (New Caledonian crow) genome, bCorMon1, alternate haplotypey

biosample.biomaterialProvider: Christian Rutz, University of St Andrews, UK

description.comment: The New Caledonian crow (Corvus moneduloides) is endemic to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. The species is renowned for its habit of manufacturing tools from plant materials, to extract prey from deadwood and vegetation. The sample was collected as part of a long-term field study led by Christian Rutz, from the University of St Andrews, and used to generate a chromosomal level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP Project.
description.title: Model organism or animal sample from Corvus moneduloides

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: New Caledonian crow sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate haplotype of the diploid genome Corvus moneduloides. The principal haplotype sequences are in WGS project WHPO00000000.
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
